result.execSummary:
The defendant Raequon D Allen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery by Prisoners [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Dane County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge remitted. $268 to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.  Court authorized payment plan.
Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.
